segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: This topic explains how to configure Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) to use the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, which integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This topic explains how to configure Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) to use the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, which integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: The instructions explain how to configure Configuration Manager Integration by using:
segment.target: The instructions explain how to configure Configuration Manager Integration by using:

segment.source: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: Before you start the configuration:
segment.target: Before you start the configuration:

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Where to get instructions
segment.target: Where to get instructions

segment.source: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.

segment.source: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology
segment.target: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology

segment.source: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.
segment.target: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you will configure an MBAM Server feature.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you will configure an MBAM Server feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For this topology, you must install the Configuration Manager console on the computer where you are installing the MBAM Server software.
segment.target: For this topology, you must install the Configuration Manager console on the computer where you are installing the MBAM Server software.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Review Windows PowerShell prerequisites (applicable only if you are going to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM).
segment.target: Review Windows PowerShell prerequisites (applicable only if you are going to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM).

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: To configure Configuration Manager Integration by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To configure Configuration Manager Integration by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Use the Enable-MbamCMIntegration Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.
segment.target: Use the Enable-MbamCMIntegration Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.

segment.source: To get information about this cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamCMIntegration.
segment.target: To get information about this cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamCMIntegration.

segment.source: To configure the System Center Configuration Manager Integration by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the System Center Configuration Manager Integration by using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to configure the System Center Configuration Manager Integration feature, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to configure the System Center Configuration Manager Integration feature, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.
segment.target: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.

segment.source: Click Add New Features, select System Center Configuration Manager Integration, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click Add New Features, select System Center Configuration Manager Integration, and then click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration have been met.

segment.source: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.
segment.target: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard:
segment.target: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard:

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services server
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services server

segment.source: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the server with the Reporting Service point role.
segment.target: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the server with the Reporting Service point role.

segment.source: This is the server to which the MBAM Configuration Manager Reports are deployed.
segment.target: This is the server to which the MBAM Configuration Manager Reports are deployed.

segment.source: If you don’t specify a server, the Configuration Manager Reports will be deployed to the local server.
segment.target: If you don’t specify a server, the Configuration Manager Reports will be deployed to the local server.

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services instance
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services instance

segment.source: Name of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) instance where the Configuration Manager Reports are deployed.
segment.target: Name of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) instance where the Configuration Manager Reports are deployed.

segment.source: If you don’t specify an instance, the Configuration Manager Reports will be deployed to the default SSRS instance name.
segment.target: If you don’t specify an instance, the Configuration Manager Reports will be deployed to the default SSRS instance name.

segment.source: The value you enter is ignored if the server has System Center 2012 Configuration Manager installed.
segment.target: The value you enter is ignored if the server has System Center 2012 Configuration Manager installed.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries you just made, click Export PowerShell Script and save the script.
segment.target: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries you just made, click Export PowerShell Script and save the script.

segment.source: Click Add to add the Configuration Manager Integration feature to the server, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Add to add the Configuration Manager Integration feature to the server, and then click Close.
